content_html: Kitsumkalum First Nation has announced the beginning of the ratification process for its proposed treaty and constitution. If ratified, the Kitsumkalum treaty will formally recognize the Nation’s rights to self-governance, land ownership, harvesting, and resource management. It would also mark the implementation of the Kitsumkalum constitution, a foundational document for self-determination and community governance. Chief Councillor Troy Sam confirmed a vote will take place on Nov.
